  • Constructor Details

    • ServiceInputParameters

      public ServiceInputParameters(Service.DockerImageSource dockerImageSource, List<String> securityGroupIdsToGrantIngressFromEcs, Map<String,String> environmentVariables)
      Knobs and dials you can configure to run a Docker image in an ECS service. The default values are set in a way to work out of the box with a Spring Boot application.
      Parameters:
      dockerImageSource - the source from where to load the Docker image that we want to deploy.
      securityGroupIdsToGrantIngressFromEcs - Ids of the security groups that the ECS containers should be granted access to.
      environmentVariables - the environment variables provided to the Java runtime within the Docker containers.

    • ServiceInputParameters

      public ServiceInputParameters(Service.DockerImageSource dockerImageSource, Map<String,String> environmentVariables)
      Knobs and dials you can configure to run a Docker image in an ECS service. The default values are set in a way to work out of the box with a Spring Boot application.
      Parameters:
      dockerImageSource - the source from where to load the Docker image that we want to deploy.
      environmentVariables - the environment variables provided to the Java runtime within the Docker containers.

  • Method Details

    • withHealthCheckIntervalSeconds

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withHealthCheckIntervalSeconds(int healthCheckIntervalSeconds)
      The interval to wait between two health checks.

      Default: 15.

    • withHealthCheckPath

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withHealthCheckPath(String healthCheckPath)
      The path of the health check URL.

      Default: "/actuator/health".

    • withContainerPort

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withContainerPort(int containerPort)
      The port the application listens on within the container.

      Default: 8080.

    • withContainerProtocol

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withContainerProtocol(String containerProtocol)
      The protocol to access the application within the container. Default: "HTTP".

    • withHealthCheckTimeoutSeconds

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withHealthCheckTimeoutSeconds(int healthCheckTimeoutSeconds)
      The number of seconds to wait for a response until a health check is deemed unsuccessful.

      Default: 5.

    • withHealthyThresholdCount

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withHealthyThresholdCount(int healthyThresholdCount)
      The number of consecutive successful health checks after which an instance is declared healthy.

      Default: 2.

    • withUnhealthyThresholdCount

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withUnhealthyThresholdCount(int unhealthyThresholdCount)
      The number of consecutive unsuccessful health checks after which an instance is declared unhealthy.

      Default: 8.

    • withCpu

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withCpu(int cpu)
      The number of CPU units allocated to each instance of the application. See the docs for a table of valid values.

      Default: 256 (0.25 CPUs).

    • withMemory

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withMemory(int memory)
      The memory allocated to each instance of the application in megabytes. See the docs for a table of valid values.

      Default: 512.

    • withLogRetention

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withLogRetention(software.amazon.awscdk.services.logs.RetentionDays logRetention)
      The duration the logs of the application should be retained.

      Default: 1 week.

    • withDesiredInstances

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withDesiredInstances(int desiredInstances)
      The number of instances that should run in parallel behind the load balancer.

      Default: 2.

    • withMaximumInstancesPercent

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withMaximumInstancesPercent(int maximumInstancesPercent)
      The maximum percentage in relation to the desired instances that may be running at the same time (for example during deployments).

      Default: 200.

    • withMinimumHealthyInstancesPercent

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withMinimumHealthyInstancesPercent(int minimumHealthyInstancesPercent)
      The minimum percentage in relation to the desired instances that must be running at the same time (for example during deployments).

      Default: 50.

    • withTaskRolePolicyStatements

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withTaskRolePolicyStatements(List<software.amazon.awscdk.services.iam.PolicyStatement> taskRolePolicyStatements)
      The list of PolicyStatement objects that define which operations this service can perform on other AWS resources (for example ALLOW sqs:GetQueueUrl for all SQS queues).

      Default: none (empty list).

    • withStickySessionsEnabled

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withStickySessionsEnabled(boolean stickySessionsEnabled)
      Disable or enable sticky sessions for the the load balancer.

      Default: false.

    • withAwsLogsDateTimeFormat

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withAwsLogsDateTimeFormat(String awsLogsDateTimeFormat)
      The format of the date time used in log entries. The awslogs driver will use this pattern to extract the timestamp from a log event and also to distinguish between multiple multi-line log events.

      Default: %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f%z (to work with JSON formatted logs created with awslogs JSON Encoder).

      See also: awslogs driver

    • withHttpListenerPriority

      public Service.ServiceInputParameters withHttpListenerPriority(int priority)
      The priority for the HTTP listener of the loadbalancer. The priority of two listeners must not be the same so you need to choose different priorities for different services.
